cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Marathon Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the Florida Keys into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico today, then toward the central Gulf Coast (MS-AL area) late Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the MS-AL border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, LA including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mississippi-Alabama border westward to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and southern Florida today, then the central Gulf Coast from Alabama through southeast Louisiana by late Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible Monday as bands pass; sustained winds below gale force are most likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (around 1 ft above normal tide levels) possible on the immediate coast, but values above 3 ft are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2â€“4 inches of rain possible Monday, with localized higher amounts that could produce temporary flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls with lightning and reduced visibility; isolated waterspouts in nearby coastal waters.
